dochead.title: &PRJ.NAME; Stand Alone Install Documentation
dochead.docdesc: These are the instruction for retrieving and installing &PRJ.NAME; as a stand alone tool on a Unix System. To use a specific version of &PRJ.NAME; with a project (note: this is probably what you wan to do), follow the instructions in &PRJ.NAME; Support Install Instructions

body.p: Note: all the commands in these instructions assume you are using the korn shell (ksh). You should also check Prerequisites before you get started.

sectbody.p: The setup and installation process retrieves and installs a number of components needed by &PRJ.NAME;. To accomidate automated setup and installation, a specific subdirectory structure is required. The root of this subdirectory structure is referenced by the TOOL_DIR environment variable.
You can use any existing directory for TOOL_DIR. For this example we will use /Projects/Devel/Support.
Here are the commands you would need to execute:
A compressed tar file containg the sources is available for anonymous ftp from:

Unless your are running your browser on the system you want to install &PRJ.NAME; on, you probably should not use the link above, but just use ftp from the host you want to install on. See Unix FTP Help for information on how to use anonymouse ftp on a Unix (Sun, AIX, Linux ..) system.

Next you need to extract the source files from &PRJ.DIR;.tar.gz. You can execute the command below referencing the original location of the file (i.e. the directory you ftp'd it to) or move it to the same location the setup process will use to store the other tar-balls it retrieves.

p.code:
mkdir $TOOL_DIR/src/Archives
cd $HOME # or were ever the &PRJ.DIR;.tar.gz file is
mv &PRJ.DIR;.tar.gz $TOOL_DIR/src/Archives

dd.p: Note the file is compressed with GNU's gzip program. To verify you are using the correct version of zcat, run 'zcat --version', if this does not report 'zcat 1.2.4', then follow the instructions in Prerequisites to install the correct version.
